metadata.title: CVE-2016-7996 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the WPG format reader in GraphicsMagick1.3.25 and earlier allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via acolormap with a large number of entries.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7996` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1').
